councilStructure: Five single-member districts, each electing one council member. Mayor elected separately. Council-manager form of government.
notes: Jefferson County suburb of Birmingham with ~6,000 residents. District-based elections confirmed via Ballotpedia and city website. Recent 2025 runoff elections for Districts 1, 3, and 4. No city-specific GIS portal found, but Jefferson County Open Data portal available for boundary data.

councilStructure: Four single-member districts plus mayor (total 5-member governing body). Council members represent specific geographic districts. District meetings held quarterly in each district.
notes: Russell County city (~37,000 residents) across Chattahoochee River from Columbus, GA. Excellent GIS infrastructure with dedicated Council Districts web viewer. Four-year terms for all positions. City Manager form of government with mayor as council president.

councilStructure: Four council members plus mayor, all elected at-large. Each member represents entire city, not specific districts. Council-Manager form of government with mayor as council president.
notes: Jefferson County Birmingham suburb (~39,000 residents). Class 7 municipality. Confirmed at-large elections where all voters can vote for all council positions. No district-based system. Jefferson County GIS available (https://data-jeffco-al.opendata.arcgis.com/) but no city-specific council district boundaries since elections are at-large.
